alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Fayette; Haywood; Lauderdale; Shelby; Tipton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 1:26PM CDT until April 05 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Mississippi County in eastern Arkansas... Tipton County in west Tennessee... Southwestern Dyer County in west Tennessee... Northwestern Fayette County in west Tennessee... Lauderdale County in west Tennessee... Western Haywood County in west Tennessee... Northeastern Shelby County in west Tennessee... * Until 215 PM CDT. * At 126 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Burdette to near Munford to near Ellendale, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Bartlett, Blytheville, Millington, Covington, Ripley, Osceola, Luxora, Fort Pillow State Park, Memphis, Munford, Brighton, Dell, Burdette, Dixonville, Ashport, Ft Pillow, Nutbush, Fulton, Tipton and Atoka. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...southeastern Missouri...and west Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...southeastern Missouri...and west Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Dyer; Fayette; Haywood; Lauderdale; Shelby; Tipton
